intro: Manothrix, commonly known as the star-of-Bahamas, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Manothrix multiflora, which is native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Manothrix typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and ease of cultivation.
